channel.title: [CHEAP HAX]Turning YOUR fire cape into a Water Cape
channel.description:
[b]BEWARE! THIS COULD **POSSIBLY TURN YOUR LAVA INTO WATER![/b]
Alright, this is client side. It will turn your Fire Cape to a Water Cape.
Ok go to [CODE] Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3 [/CODE]
Find [CODE] public static final int[] method371 [/CODE]
Now under it add
[CODE] if (i == 40) { i = 24; } [/CODE]
Now save.
Then open [CODE] Class8 [/CODE]
Search [CODE] Fire Cape [/CODE] And replace
[CODE] class8.aString170 = "Fire Cape"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A cape of fire.".getBytes(); [/CODE]
with
[CODE] class8.aString170 = "Water Cape"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A cape of water.".getBytes(); [/CODE]
Then save and compile.
The water moves on the water cape too.. Still figuring out a way to make a brand new "Water cape" instead of recoloring the fire cape's texture.
For now this would considered a cheap hax

item.title: [CHEAP HAX]Turning YOUR fire cape into a Water Cape
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:4, topic:319338”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=415808.msg3059133#msg3059133 date=1260730050]

I think everyone(basicly) knows how to do this. But good job I guess?

Atleast i am posting something ha.
Really we need to advance this community.
But we need a better tutorial section.
So I’m just posting some client hacking stuff.
[/quote]

Well this isnt really something people havent already learned. Soo, umm… try to figure out more how to client works, not how to edit it.[/quote]

That is basically a double negative.
This is showing how textures work, recolor textures.
Thats why it is a ‘cheap hax’
Real way is going into the cache, and replacing the normal texture. Or else adding a new one on.

Read full topic

item.title: [CHEAP HAX]Turning YOUR fire cape into a Water Cape
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

BEWARE! THIS COULD **POSSIBLY TURN YOUR LAVA INTO WATER!

Alright, this is client side. It will turn your Fire Cape to a Water Cape.

Ok go to

Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3

Find

public static final int[] method371

Now under it add

        if (i == 40)
        {
            i = 24;
        }

Now save.

Then open

Class8

Search

Fire Cape

And replace

class8.aString170 = "Fire Cape";
class8.aByteArray178 = "A cape of fire.".getBytes();

with

class8.aString170 = "Water Cape";
class8.aByteArray178 = "A cape of water.".getBytes();

Then save and compile.

The water moves on the water cape too…
Still figuring out a way to make a brand new “Water cape” instead of recoloring the fire cape’s texture.

For now this would considered a cheap hax
